data.title: Last Name: Meaning, Origin & Family History
data.meta_description: Skogen ranks #26534 in the US. 97.39% White in US. Norwegian: habitational name from any of numerous farmsteads, notably in eastern Norway, named with skogen,.
data.text:
How common is the last name Skogen in the United States?

Based on the Decennial U.S. Census, the surname Skogen has seen a slight decrease in popularity over the years. In 2000, it was ranked as the 26,125th most popular surname, but by 2010 it fell to 26,534th place, a small decrease of 1.57%. However, the actual count of people with the Skogen surname increased from 881 in 2000 to 919 in 2010, representing a 4.31% increase. It's interesting to note that the proportion per 100k people declined by 6.06% during the same period.

Race and Ethnicity of people with the last name Skogen

The ethnic identity associated with the surname Skogen is predominantly White, according to data from the Decennial U.S. Census. In 2000, 97.16% of those bearing the Skogen surname identified as White, and this percentage slightly rose to 97.39% in 2010. The percentage of individuals identifying as Hispanic also saw an increase from 1.14% in 2000 to 1.52% in 2010, marking a 33.33% change. In contrast, those identifying as two or more races decreased to zero in 2010 from 0.91% in 2000. There were no recorded changes for Asian/Pacific Islander, Black, and American Indian and Alaskan Native categories.
